knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

#Loading Data

```{r load data}
Sequences<-read.csv("Sequences.csv")
GC_content<-read.csv("GC_content.csv")
library("dplyr")
library(ggplot2)
Data<-select(Sequences,-Name)
```

Sequence data was calculated with NCBI ID's ("HQ433692.1","HQ433694.1","HQ433691.1") and GC_content is a 1000 specimens from 3 unknown species. The Data dataframe was made by removing the Names column from Sequences so that only the DNA sequences are shown. 

#Counting nucleotide bases 

```{r Count the number of each base pair in the 3 sequences}
T<-gsub("A|G|C","",Data$Sequence)
T<-nchar(T)
print(T)

A<-gsub("[TGC]","",Data$Sequence)
A<-nchar(A)
print(A)

G<-gsub("[TAC]","",Data$Sequence)
G<-nchar(G)
print(G)

C<-gsub("[TAG]","",Data$Sequence)
C<-nchar(C)
print(C)
```

Nucleotides A, C, T, G were calculated by subbing out all other letters than counting the amount of characters left in the string.

#GC Content
```{r GC Content}
(G+C)/(G+C+A+T)*100
```

Sequence ID|GC Content
--------|-----
HQ433692.1|44.28274%
HQ433694.1|44.07484%
HQ433691.1|44.07484%

```{r GC Content Scatterplot}
GC_content<-mutate(GC_content,GC=GC_content$G + GC_content$C)
qplot(x=ID,y=GC,data=GC_content,colour=Species,
      ylab="%GC Content",xlab="Sequence ID",main="%GC Content for 3 Species")
```
